results.title: Alexander the Great and the Battle of Issus
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Alexander the Great had conquered all of the then known world by the time of his death at 32. At the Battle of Issus, he led a charge across a river to crush a massive Persian force. Alexander’s military genius allowed him to employ daring strategems and from his victory at Issus, he went on to become one of the greatest commanders of all time.

results.title: Zembla
results.creator_credit: Katrina Salvadore and St Columba's College
results.brief_description: Zembla is a word derived from “zemblanity”, a term coined by the British author William Boyd to mean “the opposite of serendipity”.

results.title: Goanna
results.creator_credit: Anna Williams, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Anna Williams’ story is ultimately about empowerment through music. Her uncle, Harry Williams, was a famous Indigenous country musician. Anna tells his story and how his influence and inspiration has helped to empower and heal Williams.

results.title: Napoleon Bonaparte and the Battle of Austerlitz
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Napoleon remains one of the most enigmatic and skillful military leaders the world has ever seen. Exploiting the turmoil of the French Revolution, Napoleon was able to eventually become Emperor of France and then set his sights towards the rest of Europe. At the Battle of Austerlitz, Napoleon was able to command a victory against Austria and Russia.

results.title: George and his groaning mouth
results.brief_description: George complains so much he is disliked by everyone he meets. One day, while he’s whinging as usual, his mouth falls off. He is rushed to the doctor but even medical experts can’t help him. George has to cope with problems holding his mouth in his hand causes. Finally he realises he has to change his complaining ways and become a better person.

results.title: Horatio Nelson and the Battle of Trafalgar
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Nelson is considered Britain’s greatest naval hero. Throughout his early career, he was considered insuboridinate and reckless, but the genius of his miltitary leadership ensured him a place in history. His battles against rival European fleets were unparalleled successes. At the Battle of Trafalgar, Nelson ensured that Britain had mastery of the seas which brought about the subsequent expansion of the British Empire.

results.title: KnightGame
results.creator_credit: Belmont High School, Logan Bryce, Angus Latham and Ewan Breakey
results.brief_description: ‘KnightGame’ is a Medieval local multiplayer battle arena, where any stab, shield or shot could be your last. Purchase items at your base to change, strengthen and morph you and your army into fearsome warriors, then march into battle and destroy your opponent’s base to claim victory. But be wary, not all items are created equal and many will hinder you.

results.title: The Cape Barren boy
results.creator_credit: Marion Beeton, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Marion Beeton is proud of his father, Clive Beeton. A talented musician who wrote his own songs, he learnt to play the guitar through listening to the wireless.
